block.p: Alexandra Jean Hannan and Eldon Sullivan Scott Jr. were married yesterday in New York. The Rev. Susannah Smith performed the ceremony at St. James' Episcopal Church.

Mrs. Scott, 35, is the vice president for strategic analysis at the Gould Paper Corporation, a distributor in New York. She graduated from the University of Southern California. She is the daughter of Barbara Clement Gould and Joseph A. Hannan, both of New York. The bride's father retired as a senior vice president of the William Esty Advertising Company, which was in New York. Her mother is a real estate broker at the Corcoran Group in New York. The bride's stepfather, Harry E. Gould Jr., is the chairman of Gould Paper.
Alexandra Jean Hannan and Eldon Sullivan Scott Jr. were married yesterday in New York. The Rev. Susannah Smith performed the ceremony at St. James' Episcopal Church.

Mrs. Scott, 35, is the vice president for strategic analysis at the Gould Paper Corporation, a distributor in New York. She graduated from the University of Southern California. She is the daughter of Barbara Clement Gould and Joseph A. Hannan, both of New York. The bride's father retired as a senior vice president of the William Esty Advertising Company, which was in New York. Her mother is a real estate broker at the Corcoran Group in New York. The bride's stepfather, Harry E. Gould Jr., is the chairman of Gould Paper.

Mr. Scott, 38, is the president of Urban Space Management, a real estate development company in New York. He graduated from Yale and received a master's degree from the London School of Economics. He is the son of the late Rae Scott and Mr. Scott Sr. The bridegroom's mother was a real estate broker at Hunneman/Coldwell Banker in Boston. His father was the vice president for marketing at Analogic, a computer-equipment manufacturer in Peabody, Mass.
